description.narrative: Stakeholder effects Increased access to finance and green finance for WVSMEs: IFC anticipates that this project will increase access to finance for WVSMEs to support their business operations and growth. IFC expects this project to provide green finance for WMSMEs primarily for green transportation, including electric vehicles, climate-smart agriculture, energy-efficient appliance, and climate-related insurance. IFC also anticipates the Project will reduce GHG emissions by [13,738] tCO2e/yr. Market Creation - Competitiveness: The proposed Project will increase access to finance for MSMEs by demonstrating the viability and supporting the scaling up of lending to underserved segments through digital solutions. Currently, MSMEs, especially segments like WVSMEs, including those in lower-tier cities and counties of the country, are not readily served by the traditional and larger banks due to higher perceived risk. With optimized digital lending, XW Bank can acquire large numbers of underserved WVSMEs with very low marginal costs and demonstrate that digital solutions could be a viable and profitable way to address the access to finance needs of MSMEs. IFC anticipates that the market will see more traditional banks adopt digital solutions to increase the access to finance for WVSMEs.

The proposed investment is a 3-year local currency facility of up to US$150 million equivalent to XW Bank in China (XW Bank, or the Bank), dedicated to support women-owned very small, small & medium enterprises (WVSMEs). The proposed IFC financing aims to support XW Bank to grow its digital green lending to WVSMEs for up to 50% of the loan (US$75 million equivalent in RMB).
